subcategory: Difficulty for organizations in finding replacements for females during maternity or sabbatical leaves
description: This refers to the situation when managers are unable to find a suitable replacement for female team members when they take a long leave, such as maternity leave.

content.text: Organizations avoid paying the costs of wage replacement during maternity leave.
Organizations are not willing to invest the required resources to find replacements.
Organizations don’t plan well in advance for maternity leave replacements.
Employees are unwilling to fill a position for a short period of time.
Organizations should raise awareness about the benefits of retaining women during and after maternity leaves and allocate resources accordingly.
HR should work with managers to restructure the teams in such a way that when one of the team members has to go on leave, the tasks are divided amongst other resources.
Organizations should encourage fathers to take paternity leave so that taking leave at the birth of a child or during the first year of a child’s life becomes a norm.
Organizations can work on establishing a pool of former workers who are familiar with the company and could serve for a few months to handle the work.
